citation.article-title: Bacteroides chinchillae sp. nov. and Bacteroides rodentium sp. nov., isolated from chinchilla (Chinchilla lanigera) faeces
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacteroides chinchillae sp. nov.
Bacteroides chinchillae (chin.chill′ae. N.L. n. Chinchilla the zoological genus name of the chinchilla; N.L. gen. n. chinchillae of a chinchilla).
Cells on EG agar are strictly anaerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile, Gram-negative short rods or rods (1.2 µm wide and variable in length, mostly 2–15 µm).
Colonies on EG blood agar are 1–2 mm in diameter, disc-shaped, white-greyish and translucent.
Optimum temperature for growth is about 37 °C.
Grows in the presence of bile.

Produces acid from l-arabinose, cellobiose, glucose, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, sucrose and d-xylose, but not from glycerol, d-mannitol, melezitose, salicin, d-sorbitol or trehalose.
Aesculin is hydrolysed, but not gelatin.
Indole, catalase and urease are not produced.

With Rapid ID 32A, positive for α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, α-arabinosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alkaline phosphatase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, alanine arylamidase, glycine arylamidase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase and α-fucosidase, but negative for arginine dihydrolase, β-galactosidase-6-phosphate, β-glucuronidase, arginine arylamidase, proline arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, serine arylamidase and glutamic acid decarboxylase.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and anteiso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The G+C content of the type strain is 45.2 %.
The type strain is ST170T ( = JCM 16497T = CCUG 59335T), isolated from faeces of a chinchilla.
One additional strain, ST180 ( = JCM 16498), also isolated from chinchilla faeces, is included in this species.
